title.narrative: Corona prevention and preparedness border provinces of Afghanistan

description.narrative:
Afghanistan battling the prolong armed conflict, injustice and poverty (54.5% people are below poverty line ) now facing the Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), which is an infectious disease caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus. The disease was first identified in 2019 in Wuhan, China, and has since spread globally, resulting in the 2019–20 coronavirus pandemic and found more than 200,000 people infected globally and killed more than 6,000 people ( as of 18-March-2020). The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the 2019–20 coronavirus outbreak a pandemic and a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC). Evidence of local transmission of the disease has been found in many countries.
Afghanistan has a very poor health system in the world and has a very low Capacity. In the counter the health expenditure is US$ 905 per capita while the health ministry allocated US$ 58 per capita. More than 4 million of Afghan refugees are living in Iran and Pakistan. Iran was found the second most infected country in Asia after china, there are movement of refugees and other Afghan civilian to and from Iran, the COVID-19 cases has been detected in the country with 22 positive cases (as of 18-Marc-2020). The people in the country has concern on the reported cases because of the capacity of the government and do believe that the cases are much higher which may create another disaster in the country and may affect the whole region.

Awareness Sessions for the prevention of COVID-19 Soap Distribution
Increasing Government capacity for conducting test Assisting most vulnerable people with cash for food
General population with focus on COVID-19 positive cases.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
